Greatest common divisor of a finite set

type:
{Œ± : Type u_1} ‚Üí
  {Œ≤ : Type u_2} ‚Üí [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero Œ±] ‚Üí [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid Œ±] ‚Üí Finset Œ≤ ‚Üí (Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ±) ‚Üí Œ±
name: Finset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a finite set

For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number Œ¥, the set {x : E | ‚à•x‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥ ‚à® x ‚àà s} equals the set {x : E | ‚à•x - o ‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥}, where o is the origin of E.

type: ‚àÄ {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] (Œ¥ : ‚Ñù) (s : Set E), Metric.ball 0 Œ¥ + s = Metric.thickening Œ¥ s
name: ball_add_zero
docString: For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number Œ¥, the set {x : E | ‚à•x‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥ ‚à® x ‚àà s} equals the set {x : E | ‚à•x - o ‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥}, where o is the origin of E.

The theorem `Nat.gcd_pos_of_pos_left` states that for all natural numbers `m` and `n`, if `m` is greater than 0, then the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `m` and `n` is also greater than 0. In other words, if a natural number `m` is positive, its gcd with any other natural number `n` is also positive.

type: ‚àÄ {m : ‚Ñï} (n : ‚Ñï), 0 < m ‚Üí 0 < m.gcd n
name: Nat.gcd_pos_of_pos_left
docString: The theorem `Nat.gcd_pos_of_pos_left` states that for all natural numbers `m` and `n`, if `m` is greater than 0, then the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `m` and `n` is also greater than 0. In other words, if a natural number `m` is positive, its gcd with any other natural number `n` is also positive.

Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

type:
‚àÄ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ‚Ü•(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  0 < IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ‚Üëx
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_zero_le
docString: Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

For all natural numbers $n$, $1$ is a proper divisor of $n$ if and only if $n$ is a positive integer.

type: ‚àÄ {n : ‚Ñï}, 1 ‚àà n.properDivisors ‚Üî 1 < n
name: Nat.one_mem_properDivisors_iff_one_lt
docString: For all natural numbers $n$, $1$ is a proper divisor of $n$ if and only if $n$ is a positive integer.

This theorem, `Nat.pos_of_dvd_of_pos`, states that for any two natural numbers `m` and `n`, if `m` divides `n` and `n` is greater than 0, then `m` is also greater than 0. In terms of number theory, it asserts that a non-zero number cannot be divided by zero, since division by zero is undefined.

type: ‚àÄ {m n : ‚Ñï}, m ‚à£ n ‚Üí 0 < n ‚Üí 0 < m
name: Nat.pos_of_dvd_of_pos
docString: This theorem, `Nat.pos_of_dvd_of_pos`, states that for any two natural numbers `m` and `n`, if `m` divides `n` and `n` is greater than 0, then `m` is also greater than 0. In terms of number theory, it asserts that a non-zero number cannot be divided by zero, since division by zero is undefined.
